citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Availability of records: At the time of the inspection, the Licensee could not locate documents/records that are required
under the AWA (specifically the written Program of Veterinary Care and the Contingency Plan). As a result, these required
documents/records could not be reviewed during the inspection.
Per this Section, all documents and records that are required to be kept under the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) should be
on the premises and available at the time of an inspection so the required records can be reviewed to determine the
facility's compliance with the provisions of the AWA. Correct by 8/14/23.

The goat and sheep pen is comprised of a wooden fence plus a second layer of 1” x 1” wire mesh fencing that is attached
on the inside surface of the wooden fence facing the animals. The left side and the left front sections of the pen also have
a third layer of chicken wire fencing that is attached to the 1” x 1” wire mesh and faces the animal side of the pen. The
layer of chicken wire had detached from the wire mesh in multiple spots of the pen’s fence. As a result, there were cut
pieces of wire having sharp points projecting into the pen and there were some areas where a portion of the detached
chicken wire fencing had curled outwards and into the animal pen. The sharp points and detached portions of chicken
wire could cause an injury to the animals.
Per this Section, outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury. The Licensee corrected this item during the inspection by addressing the areas of detached chicken
wire fencing.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with a facility representative.
